fields.description:
h3. Summary

After changing the Confluence title, the new title is not displayed in the navigation bar from Jira.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#Acces Confluence> Settings
#Edit Site Configuration
#Insert a new title in the field Site Title
#Press Save
#Acces Jira
h3. Expected Results

The new Confluence title is shown in the navigation bar.

This happens only in Confluence (see screenshot).
h3. Actual Results

In Jira, the new Confluence title is not shown in the navigation bar. Confluence title stays "Confluence" (see screenshot from Jira).
h3. Notes

In Confluence, the new title is properly shown (see the screenshot from Confluence).
h3. Workaround

no workaround
fields.summary: In Jira a changed Confluence title is not displayed in the navigation bar
Change the URL of Cloud Project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
 - The Google search engine crawls information from the cloud when the browse project permission is set to "Anyone". Hence, the result is cached and can be viewed publicly.
 - Since the Atlassian cloud architecture is upgrading, it is not possible to remove and it is crucial for the customers, as their information on the cloud is being exposed publicly.

h3. Suggested Resolution

- The ability to remove the google search result
fields.summary: A feature to remove cloud pages from google result

fields.description: I could not find the path to either of our Jira or Confluence spaces (cloud) this morning and even though I signed in to my.atlassian.com  there where no links or references to what URL it should be hosted at. I had to wait for my colleagues to arrive before I could get into the spaces.
fields.summary: Links to your own Confluence/Jira spaces from my.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Activities are not being updated at Atlassian Home > Activity > *Watching* session (https://example.net/home/activity). Currently, only *All* tab is updating users from recent activities. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a user creating/working on content on Confluence or Jira.
# Access https://example.atlassian.net/home/activity
# Click on Watching tab 

h3. Expected Results

The current modification/activity should be displayed on the *Watching* tab in regards to the current operation performed by the user.

h3. Actual Results
Activities are not being updated or displaying the modifications.

h3.Notes

On the *All* activities tab (https://example.atlassian.net/home/activity/all), the modifications are displayed.

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround unless to have the user watching the updates on the *All* tab.
fields.summary: Atlassian Home > Activity > Watching session not showing activities
Test1

fields.description:
On iOS mobile devices (iPad, iPhone) the web browser version automatically defaults to a ‘mobile’ version of the website, however there isn’t a mobile version of the website, so it comes up in error.

It’s very hard to find your way back to the desktop version from that error, and if you close and open the page again, it goes back to the ‘mobile’ version again.

Furthermore, if you manage to switch to the desktop version on your mobile device, there is a constant prompt at the top of the page asking you to switch to the mobile version, which again takes you to the error as the mobile version doesn’t exist.

It’s essential that if there isn’t to be a mobile version – which is fine as the desktop version is more than sufficient – that the default site on mobile devices is the desktop site, and that the prompt to move to the mobile version at the top of the page is removed. There should be no way to get to the ‘mobile’ version from a mobile device, as a mobile version doesn’t exist.
fields.summary: On iOS mobile devices (iPad, iPhone) the web browser version of Confluence Cloud automatically defaults to a ‘mobile’ version of the website

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding javascript code to a description field in Jira issues if the code have a double quote inside a single quoted line Jira will render it wrong.

h3. Environment
* Tested on Jira 240e3d8c


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in Jira and in the field description insert a block of code containing a double quote inside a single quoted line.

h3. Expected Results
The double quote should be highlighted as part of the line that is single quoted as the example below:
   !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 19.02.41.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
When adding JavaScript code to an issue's description, the highlighting is wrong when encountering a double-quote inside a single-quoted string. The system treats the rest of the code as a string until it gets to another double-quote as the example below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-18 at 19.02.31.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue descriptions with Javascript code have incorrect rendered highlighting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we take a look at the User Management, the Last Active field displays a date and time, for customers which are inactive for a long time, it displays that they logged on worked on inaccurate dates. This can be confirmed by looking at the Atlassian Account logs since it has a Last Active field. On Atlassian Account, we can see that the user is inactive for more time than displayed in the Cloud Instance User Management.

h3. Environment
(!) Cloud, User Management

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a user profile on User Management that is inactive for a long time
# Compare with Atlassian Account Last Active time
# Times will be different

h3. Expected Results
The Last Active is inaccurate.

h3. Actual Results
Last Active field should display the right date and time.
 
h3.Workaround
No Workaround for customers.
fields.summary: Last Active inform inaccurate time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

API to delete groups from roles does not work when group name has spaces.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a group e.g. "this group" on a project role
# Run https://myinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/project/PRO/role/10000?group="Service desk admins" (the result is the same as ' ')

h3. Expected Results

The group is removed from the role

h3. Actual Results

API returns 204 and the group is not removed
 
h3.Workaround

Go to the People tab on the project and click "Remove".
fields.summary: API to delete groups from roles does not work when group name has spaces

fields.description: Update the list of IP Ranges and Domains listed on the official documentation at: [Atlassian Documentation - Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html]
fields.summary: Update Documentation on Atlassian Cloud IP Ranges and Domains

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira and Confluence have a feature to export backup and require logged-in [Supported browsers|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html] to download the backup via the generated link.
 Therefore, to migrate from Cloud to Server products, an administrator needs to download the backup file once and then upload to the remote server to restore. It's preferred to be able to download the backup directly to the remote server because these backups tend to be large (like over 100 GB) generally.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide an option to create shareable link can be easily downloaded by command line tools like {{wget}}, {{curl}} and {{aria2}}.
* Support backup objects on Restful API
* Integrate with [Dropbox|https://www.dropbox.com/developers/saver]

h3. Workaround

Use command line tools with valid cookie in request header. Note that this is not officially supported.


{panel:title=(!) These backup scripts are not officially supported|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
The below ones are working at the moment but the endpoints can change without notice:

* JIRA: https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/issues/16/endpoint-changed-for-jira-again-new-script
* Confluence: https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/issues/17/backup-script-for-confluence-cloud-find-it

For Power Shell: https://bitbucket.org/atlassianlabs/automatic-cloud-backup/issues/15/rest-url-is-coming-back-as-a-dead-link.
{panel}
fields.summary: Sharable URL for backup file

fields.description:
We experience a *major issue* when trying to export a specific Confluence project/space which should be imported to the Confluence servers of a customer.

When trying to export something, we can only get an export of everything from the cloud. No certain project/space can be selected.

We need a quick solution (or workaround) to export only a certain project/space to afterwards import it into the customers' server.

The same applies to the corresponding Jira project.
fields.summary: Confluence export from Cloud to migrate to Server does not allow to specify a project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* In user profile page (https://<instance-url>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa) under Password, user is instructed to update the details through his/her Atlassian account:
 !Profile details.png|thumbnail! 
* This hint/instruction is same if the user's account is being managed through Organization which has configured in the application.

h3. Suggested Solution
* When an Organization is configured in the application (i.e. JIRA), this hint/instruction should be updated/changed for those users whose account's details is being managed within the organization.

h3. Why this is important
* If the user's account is being managed through Organization, this hint/instruction is misleading the user. And when user accesses his/her Atlassian account, he/she is unable to update the account's details.
fields.summary: Update the instruction/hint for updating profile details

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira Time-Tracking is only visible on view issue screen if a value was added when the issue was created. If there was no value define during issue creation, user will need to add from Edit issue screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
An inline-editing option for user to add the value immediately from view issue screen instead of edit issue screen

h3. Why this is important
It would reduce the time spent of clicking one page to another in order to add the value for Time-Tracking
fields.summary: Inline-editing option for Jira Time-Tracking

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The ability for either the administrator of a JIRA Cloud instance or the user to change their profile back to private is not available after they choose public.   This should be an option either for the administrator or the user to change.
h3.Workaround
# Have the user login to http://id.atlassian.com and change their fullname to their username.
# [Verify the domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/domain-verification-873871234.html] the user is on so that you can edit their full name. You can then set it as their username.
fields.summary: Ability to change users profile back to private from public

fields.description:
Preconditions:
 * Any Cloud App, created in java using atlassian-connect-spring-boot-starter
 * network latency or additional logic for '/installed' endpoint

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Install app into Cloud Jira. Jira sends POST request to '/installed' endpoint of the app
 # The app receives the request but takes longer time to respond with success status (due to network issues for example). Jira timeout is approximately 10 seconds
 # Jira timeout expires and it shows the error message about installation failure
 # User tries to install app again and gets installation error (401 Unauthorized) 

This issue breaks synchronization between Cloud Host (Jira) and Atlassian Connect framework, responsible for app lifecycle on the app side.

 

*Notes:* 
 * reproduced on java app, using atlassian-connect-spring-boot-starter:1.3.1
 * app actually handles '/installed' request correctly, saves the AtlassianHost, but fails to provide successful response status in limited time
 * Host(Jira) after first attempt generates new sharedSecret and signs new JWT token for authorization. It adds new sharedSecret to all consequent '/installed' requests, but they will permanently fail, cause app already has outdated sharedSecret, saved by Atlassian Connect on first attempt
fields.summary: Unable to install plugin after timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the Site Title of Confluence to something else, the Site Title is not properly populated causing the app switcher to not display the new name properly.

=== Changed Site Title ===
 !Changed Site title.png|thumbnail! 
===

h3. Expected Results
All App switchers report the correct value for the site title as the name of Confluence.

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will list whatever the site title was prior (this will generally be just "Conflunce").
=== JIRA Displays Wrong Name ===
 !JIRA lists Confluence improperly.png|thumbnail! 
===

Atlassian Home displays Confluence twice, once with the old name, and once with the new name.
=== Atlassian Home Displays Confluence Twice ===
 !Atlassian Home lists Confluence twice.png|thumbnail! 
===

Confluence and Admin will both show the correct values as expected.

h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Changing Confluence Site Title does not properly populate App Switcher

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add 2 attachments with the same name, add a comment with link to both attachments, the second link will be broken. However, opening the attachments through the Attachments section, both will open correctly.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud a53fe373 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*In a Service Desk project*
# Create a txt file and write fileA inside it. Name it file.txt
# Create a txt file and write fileB inside it. Name it file.txt
# In a test issue, in the Attachments section, click Browse and attach the first file.txt (the fileA). In the comments, write fileA
# Again, in the Attachments section, click Browse and attach the second file.txt (fileB). In the comments, write fileB

At this point, you have 2 files attached, the old one is greyed out and the new one is in blue, both with the same name.
If you open them through the Attachments section, the greyed out will be fileA, which was the first you attached, and the blue one will be fileB, the second you attached.
However, in the comments section, the first comment will open fileA and the second comment will open also fileA.

*In a Software project*
# Create a txt file and write fileA inside it. Name it file.txt
# Create a txt file and write fileB inside it. Name it file.txt
# In a test issue, click Comment, click Attachment, click Browse, attach the first file.txt (the fileA). Write fileA and click Add.
# In a test issue, click Comment, click Attachment, click Browse, attach the second file.txt (the fileB). Write fileB and click Add.

At this point, you have 2 files attached, the old one is named "file" and the link is blue. The new one is named "file (f57fc463-c63c-4fd8-92be-e73fdb9aadc1)" and the link color is also blue.
If you open them through the Attachments section, the "file" will be fileA, which was the first you attached, and the "file (string)" will be fileB, the second you attached.
However, in the comments section, the first comment will open fileA and the second comment will open also fileA.

h3. Expected Results
The links will also update.

h3. Actual Results
The second link breaks.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Attachment link in comment breaks if another attachment with same name is added

fields.description:
This is the solution that would be good to implement now that we have started supporting SAML 2.0

Currently we do not have clear documented and tested steps for Atlassian Cloud to access ADFS example some vendor ADFS as IDP provides standard SAML 2.0 and therefore expected to have a claim based solution which allows token exchange with Atlassian Cloud. 

This feature is crucial for moving forward on SAML ADFS solutions.
fields.summary: ADFS SAML 2.0 Solution

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Enabling "Prevent cross-site tracking" in Safari or "Block third-party cookies" in Chrome will cause the Atlassian Cloud Home page to be stuck in a redirect loop.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Enable the following configurations in the Safari or Chrome
{quote}
Safari 11 : "Prevent cross-site tracking" enabled *in Preferences... > Privacy*
Chrome : "Block third-party cookies" enabled in *Settings > Content settings > Cookies*
{quote}
 * Access the Atlassian Cloud home page : https://cloud.atlassian.net/home 

The page will be stuck in redirect loop with https://id.atlassian.com
 

To workaround the issue :

- Disable the settings in Safari 11 
- In Chrome, add the exceptions to allow third party cookies for the domains as documented on the [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html]
fields.summary: Home page stuck in a redirect loop

fields.description: Please add the ability to edit the formatting of the "Text only" notifications.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the formatting of text based emails.

fields.description:
For customer who have restrictive network, it is important that the IP ranges information as specified on [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] page are up to date and fully configured on their side to avoid service disruption. At the moment, there is no way to keep updated if the IP address range and domains are changed. 

It would be really helpful if there would be a way to notify the administrators for any changes on the [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] page.

Option 1: Add a watch option on [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] page 

Option 2: Notify the Technical contacts when the [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] page gets updated.
fields.summary: IP address range change notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an email fails to be processed in SendGrid, the users are unaware of this. Users will not receive the mail and will raise a ticket to Support for checking SendGrid if there is any block from our end.
h3. Suggested Solution 

There needs to be some sort indication/feedback to the user if the email that's sent out to them has been blocked (failed to be processed). That way they are aware and can reach out to Support faster.
fields.summary: Notify users when SendGrid has blocked emails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the New JIRA experience, the hamburger icon on the bottom left corner does not popup the menu if clicked on the area of the outer circle. The icon shows the styling of being clicked, but the menu does not appear. Please refer to the video for a clearer understanding.

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the New Jira Experience
# Go to <instance-name>/secure/Dashboard.jspa
# On the hamburger icon on the bottom left of the page, click on the area closest to the outer circle.

h3. Expected Results
The icon will be highlighted, and the menu will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The icon will be highlighted, but the menu does not appear.

h3. Workaround
Click on the actual hamburger icon, instead of the outer area of the circle.
fields.summary: When using the New Jira Experience, the Hamburger Icon is unresponsive when Clicked near the outer area of the circle

fields.description:
By default, whenever a team member takes action on an issue (changing the status, for example), all channels and DM groups that the bot is invited to get spammed with a notification of it so it looks like suddenly every person you want to chat with about JIRA issues is saying something to you and you have to go click through all the DM groups to clear the "new messages" status.

If I edit the projects after adding them, I see that I can uncheck all the boxes and get the bot to not send notifications of everything, all the time, to everyone.  But I would still like to know when the other person in the DM group takes certain actions (like putting an issue in review that I'm listed as a reviewer on).  The current setting is an all-or-nothing for the project and all users.  If I've got a DM channel with coworker Sally and JIRA Cloud, I either can't know about anything, or I have to know about Sally's _and_ Bob's _and_ Jim's issues (in every project) being transitioned, even though Bob and Jim aren't in the DM group.

I don't know if it's possible to provide fine-grained controls like "only notify me in this channel when anyone in this channel transitions an issue to a given status and I'm listed as a reviewer on the issue".  But at least allowing filtering based on who's involved in the slack channel/DM group would make enabling the notifications features useful.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of Jira Cloud for Slack notifications

fields.description:
If a user clicks on one of the billing links (e.g. Payment Details, Billing History), rather than have a spinner on the screen forever the screen should display a message such as: “You do not have permission to view this screen. Please contact your account manager.”
It is poor UI design to have a spinner displayed on a screen when nothing is in the process of loading on the server.
fields.summary: It is poor UI design to have a spinner displayed on a screen when nothing is in the process of loading on the server.
JiraProject

fields.description:
According to [Atlassian Cloud storage policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-storage-policy-873871366.html]
h4. What will happen if I exceed my storage limit?

If your Atlassian Cloud instance exceeds the storage limit, your instance *will* *not* be suspended, except in extreme circumstances, and we *will* *not* remove any data. If you exceed your storage limit by a small amount, and you're storing acceptable types of data, your applications will continue to work (large video files are an example of an unacceptable attachment data type). If you exceed the limit by a large amount, we'll email your technical contact and offer help to reduce disk usage by archiving old Confluence or Jira application attachments.

Above statement is misleading and has the potential to confused the customer as Atlassian Support do not delete or remove customer data at any circumstances.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a line in that section to explain that we Atlassian Support would only provide what we could gather from our end regarding customer's instance storage details. This would help the customer to get the overview about their instance storage details so that they can plan accordingly from their end to archive the data/attachment. We should also explain what does archiving means here and who/how to archive the data.
fields.summary: Update Atlassian Cloud storage policy for storage limit section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
During outages or maintenance windows, the Cloud applications currently display *Page Unavailable* / *Oops, something went wrong* messages. Besides that, there's no indication of how the team using the site should proceed during that time.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a way to customize this page so that administrators can share with their teams how to proceed in case of outages. E.g., admins can add notes asking issues that need immediate attention to be created through a specific mail address.
* Alternatively, offer a way to banner sites during downtime.

h3. Why this is important
So that customers can communicate accordingly during outages in the sites.
fields.summary: Add the ability to customize the outage notification pages in Atlassian Cloud
Test1

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The User list looks correct over all pages, but after paging through all pages (replicated with 2 pages and with 15 pages) and clicking on Users in the left menu the page number links are not displayed on page 1.
If we go on page 15 and go back one page (click on 14) the page number links do appear at the bottom of the page.  Refreshing page 1 will display the page number links.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on user (left menu);
 # Navegate trough all pages;
 # Click on Users again;

h3. Expected Results

The number of pages and links is displayed in the bottom of the page
h3. Actual Results

!Links_next_pages.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: User pagination missing after go through all pages

fields.description: When accepting a pull request to a Mercurial repository via Squash (rebase --collapse), the resulting commit is attributed to my name and email. In the case where there is only a single commit or all of the commits have the same author (by far the common case, one assumes), the rebased commit should be attributed to the original author.
fields.summary: Preserve author when rebasing merge requests
